Comment: She is the role model for the RWNJ women like Mace, Bobert and Greene. They learned that if you stay in the media eye, you gain power. Her problem is that she became the punchline to a running joke, and so she hasn't been able to stay in the klieg lights.   The article describes her slow fall from THE Republican It Girl to irrelevance today. She has gone from being a paid contributor on Fox to an infrequent, unpaid guest. She had a PAC which she was part of, but that is gone now.  The author proposes that she is now trying to be an influencer, and that she said that she had offered her services to the Trump administration, but there have been no offers.
